Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of chariot to right (part of chariot box and haunch and tail of two horses, one in added white, remaining); below, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 396, no. B579, pl. CXCV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1391) (phase 3)
